datafield.subfield: Precision Tests of the Standard Model with Kaon Decays at CERN

Selected precision Standard Model tests performed in the recent past or possible in the near future using kaon decays are discussed, with a focus on unambiguous signatures, such as those for Lepton-Flavor violation (LFV) andLepton-Number violation (LNV) transitions, and on the physics reach at the high-intensity beams produced at the CERN SPS for the NA48/2 and NA62 experiments. Recent results on the search for the LNV process $K^{\pm}\to\pi^{\mp}\mu^\pm\mu^\pm$ and for LFV-induced deviations from the SM expectationfor the ratio of decays widths for $K^+\to e^+\nu$ and $K^+\to \mu^+\nu$ are briefly discussed. Sensitivity improvements with the new phase of NA62 on a variety of observables are outlined.
